Feature.DoorOpen.Name: Door Open Alert
Feature.DoorOpen.Description: Your Smart Refrigerator knows when someone left the door open for more than 5 minutes.  You can set your preferred alert notification in Preferences.
Feature.VacationAssistant.Name: Vacation Assistant
Feature.VacationAssistant.Description: The Vacation Assistant feature saves energy by not running as many automatic defrost cycles.  Your refrigerator remains in this mode until a door is opened or you turn the feature off.
Feature.WaterFilterStatus.Name: Water Filter Status
Feature.WaterFilterStatus.Description: Your refrigerator will let you know when it's time to order and replace the water filter so that your family is always drinking great water.

DoorOpenSG.Name: Door Status
DoorOpenSG.Description: Your refrigerator knows if the door has been left open for more than 5 minutes. You can set your preferred alert notification in Preferences.

PowerOnSG.Name: Power/Wi-Fi Restored
PowerOnSG.Description: You will receive an alert when power or Wi-Fi to your refrigerator is restored.

PowerOut.Name: Power/Wi-Fi Outage
PowerOut.Description: You will receive an alert if your refrigerator loses power or connection to Wi-Fi.

WaterFilterChange.Name: Water Filter Status
WaterFilterChange.Description: Your refrigerator will let you know when it's time to order and replace the water filter.

SmartTip.Title: Tip 1
SmartTip.Content: Enforce a no open-container rule. Cover liquids and wrap solid edibles in your refrigerator. Uncovered foods release moisture, making your fridge work harder to stay cool.

SmartTip.Title: Tip 2
SmartTip.Content: Some fruits like avocados, bananas and peaches release ethylene gas as they ripen. Be sure to store them separately from ethylene-sensitive produce like apples, broccoli and grapes to keep all of your produce fresher, longer.
